info.title: Channel Open Api
info.description:
Channel Open API. You may need Access Key and Access Secret credentials for authentication.

Documentation can be found at [Channel developers page](https://developers.channel.io/docs/authentication-2).

If you have any questions, feel free to contact us through the chat button in the lower right corner.

post.summary: Announce to a set of specific managers

parameters.name: botName
parameters.description: Name of the bot sending the message

parameters.name: managerIds
parameters.description: Ids of managers to be announced

requestBody.description: JSON object defining the new message

parameters.name: botName
parameters.description: Name of the bot sending the message

requestBody.description: JSON object defining the new message

get.summary: Retrieve a list of bots.
get.description:
The number of bots retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all bots.

If the `since` parameter is left empty, the list retrieved will start with the first bot in descending order of createdAt

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Unix timestamp value of the first bot to be retrieved in descending order

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restrict the maximum number of results (range[1, 500])

requestBody.description: JSON object defining the new bot

parameters.name: botId
parameters.description: ID of the bot to be deleted

get.summary: Retrieve a list of campaigns.
get.description:
The number of campaigns retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all campaigns.

If the `since` parameter is left empty, the list retrieved will start with the first campaign in descending order of updatedAt.

The `states` query parameter is a set of campaign states. If it is left empty, the retrieved list will contain all campaigns regardless of states.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restrict the maximum number of results (range[1, 500])

get.summary: Retrieve a campaign by id.
Retrieve a campaign user by campaignId and userId.
Retrieve a list of campaign users who received the campaign.
get.description:
The number of campaign users retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all campaign users.

If the `since` parameter is left empty, the list retrieved will start with the first campaign users ordered by `state` and `sortOrder` parameter.

The type of retrieved campaign users is decided by the `state` query parameter. The `state` parameter cannot be empty, and must be one of the following states; `sent`, `view`, `goal` or `click`.

The campaign users who has been updated more than a year ago will not be retrieved.

The campaign user is a target of the unify process. In other words, the campaign user data will be unified if one is logged in afterwards.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restrict the maximum number of results (range[1, 500])

get.summary: Retrieve a channel connected with the given API key credentials
List of chat tags
get.description:
The number of chat tags retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all chat tags

The `since` parameter can be left empty to start the list.

get.summary: List of public groups
get.description:
The groups retrieved through this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1,500]`

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next`value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all public groups in the channel.If the `since` parameter is left empty, the list retrieved will start with the first group in ascending order of group.name

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Name of the first group to be retrieved in ascending order

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restrict the maximum number of results (range[1, 500])

get.summary: List of members in a public group
Retrieve a list of messages in a chat.
get.description:
The number of messages retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query  parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all messages in the chat.

If the `since` parameter is left empty, the list retrieved will start with the first message (as specified by the `order` parameter).

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Order of messages (descending order means latest message first)

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Unix timestamp value of the first message to be retrieved

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restrict the maximum number of results (range[1, 500])

post.summary: Send a new message to a chat.

parameters.name: botName
parameters.description: Name of the bot sending the message

requestBody.description: JSON object defining the new message

If the `since` parameter is left empty, the list retrieved will start with the first message (as specified by the `order` parameter).

Retrieve a list of managers.
get.description:
The number of managers retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query  parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all managers.

The `since` parameter can be left empty to start the list.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: ID of the first manager to be retrieved in ascending order

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restrict the maximum number of results (range[1, 500])

get.summary: Retrieve a list of oneTimeMsgs.
get.description:
The number of oneTimeMsgs retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all oneTimeMsgs.

If the `since` parameter is left empty, the list retrieved will start with the first oneTimeMsg in descending order of updatedAt.

The `states` query parameter is a set of oneTimeMsg states. If it is left empty, the retrieved list will contain all oneTimeMsgs regardless of states.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restrict the maximum number of results (range[1, 500])

The number of oneTimeMsg users retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all oneTimeMsg users.

If the `since` parameter is left empty, the list retrieved will start with the first oneTimeMsg users ordered by `state` and `sortOrder` parameter.

Type of retrieved oneTimeMsg users are decided by `state` query parameter. `state` parameter cannot be empty, and must be one of the following states; `sent`, `view`, `goal` and `click`.

The oneTimeMsg users who has been updated more than a year ago will not be retrieved.

The oneTimeMsg user is not a target of the unify process. In other words, the oneTimeMsg user data would not be unified even if one is logged in afterwards.

get.summary: List of user chats in managed state
get.description:
The number of user chats retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Retrieved user chats can be filtered by `opened`, `snoozed`, and `closed` through the `state` query parameter.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all user chats.

The `since` parameter can be left empty to start the list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restrict the maximum number of results (range[1, 500])

get.summary: List of members in a user chat
Retrieve a list of messages in a chat.

The number of messages retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query  parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all messages in the chat.

If the `since` parameter is left empty, the list retrieved will start with the first message (as specified by the `order` parameter).

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Order of messages (descending order means latest message first)

get.summary: Get meet available managers
Get average wrap-up time
get.description:
Retrieve the average wrap-up time for calls within a specified time range.
The term "wrap-up time" refers to the duration between the close of a call and the subsequent closure of the user chat.
The return unit is in seconds.

from (Query Parameter): Represents the start time of the desired time range for fetching wrap-up time. It is a required parameter and must be a non-null Unix timestamps in milliseconds.

to (Query Parameter): Represents the end time of the desired time range for fetching wrap-up time. It is a required parameter and must be a non-null Unix timestamps in milliseconds.

get.summary: Get call logs
get.description:
Retrieve a list of call logs within a specified time range.

from (Query Parameter): Represents the start time of the desired time range for fetching call logs. It is a required parameter and must be a non-null Unix timestamps in milliseconds.

to (Query Parameter): Represents the end time of the desired time range for fetching call logs. It is a required parameter and must be a non-null Unix timestamps in milliseconds.

post.description:
The redirection url generated through this endpoint needs `url` and `expiration`.

`url` must be channel url(ex: `https://example.channel.io`, `https://customer.channel.io`.

`url` must contains channel's domain(ex: `https://{your_domain}.channel.io`)

`expiration` must be ISO8601 duration(ex: `PT1H`, `P15D`).

`expiration` must be between 1 minute and 30 days. 

if `expiration` is `null`, the expiration is set to 1 minute.

get.summary: List user chat cases
get.description:
Retrieve a list of user chat cases within a specified time range.

`from` (Query Parameter): Represents the start time of the desired time range for fetching cases (Unix timestamp in milliseconds). Required.

`to` (Query Parameter): Represents the end time of the desired time range for fetching cases (Unix timestamp in milliseconds). Required.

The duration between `from` and `to` cannot exceed 90 days.

`since` (Query Parameter): Cursor for pagination. Optional.

`limit` (Query Parameter): Restricts the maximum number of results. Range [1, 500]. Default is 25. Optional.

`sortOrder` (Query Parameter): Sort order of the results. Can be `asc` or `desc`. Default is `desc`. Optional.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restrict the maximum number of results (range[1, 500])

get.summary: List of user chats in managed state
get.description:
The number of user chats retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Retrieved user chats can be filtered by `opened`, `snoozed`, and `closed` through the `state` query parameter.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all user chats.

The `since` parameter can be left empty to start the list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restrict the maximum number of results (range[1, 500])

get.summary: Download a recording of a call meet.
get.description:
This endpoint allows you to download the recording of a call meet. The recording is returned as an audio/mp4 file.

The signed URL is valid for 15 minutes.

parameters.name: userChatId
parameters.description: ID of the user chat to be accessed

get.summary: Retrieve a list of messages in a stt chat.
get.description:
The number of messages retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query  parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all messages in the stt chat.

If the `since` parameter is left empty, the list retrieved will start with the first message (as specified by the `order` parameter).

parameters.name: userChatId
parameters.description: ID of the user chat to be accessed

get.summary: List of members in a user chat
Retrieve a list of messages in a chat.
get.description:
The number of messages retrieved in this endpoint is restricted by the `limit` query  parameter, and is capped to values in the closed interval `[1, 500]`.

Pagination is supported through the `since` query parameter along with the `next` value contained in the root object of the JSON response. Successive queries to this endpoint using the previous `next` value as the `since` parameter will ultimately retrieve all messages in the chat.

If the `since` parameter is left empty, the list retrieved will start with the first message (as specified by the `order` parameter).

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Order of messages (descending order means latest message first)

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Unix timestamp value of the first message to be retrieved

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Restrict the maximum number of results (range[1, 500])

parameters.name: userChatId
parameters.description: ID of the user chat to be accessed

get.summary: Get a user
Get a user by memberId

put.summary: Create or patch a user by memberId

put.description:
To get sessionJWT through this endpoint needs `memberId` and `expiration`.

`expiration` must be between 1 minute and 30 days. 

if `expiration` is `null`, the expiration is set to 1 minute.
